capability_questions.question: Maintain State Plan Is the process primarily manual or automatic? change? throughout the organization? use standards in the process? performing the process?

levels.level_1: manual paper-based activity to accomplish tasks. SMA is unable to adapt easily to changes to the Medicaid State Plan and provide timely information to stakeholders. SMA is unable to trace operational activities directly to Medicaid State Plan. SMA focuses on meeting compliance thresholds for state and federal regulations using state-specific standards. Very little collaboration occurs with other agencies to standardize information exchange or business tasks.
levels.level_2: automatic processes to accomplish tasks. SMA uses tools to gather, record, analyze, formulate, communicate, and distribute information on Medicaid State Plan to SMA leadership and other state agencies. SMA distributes Medicaid State Plan electronically to stakeholders. SMA is able to develop and maintained Medicaid State Plan with collaboration from Maintain State Plan other agencies that encourages flexibility. SMA is able to trace some operational activities directly to Medicaid State Plan. SMA applies a mix of nationally recognized and state-specific standards. SMA collaborates Maintain State Plan with other agencies and entities to adopt standards and Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions.
levels.level_3: extent possible within the intrastate. SMA uses brainstorming and automatic collaboration tools, which enables statewide input to the Medicaid State Plan setting process. SMA develops and maintains Medicaid State Plan with collaboration from other intrastate agencies. SMA quickly distributes modifications to policy to stakeholders. SMA directly ties all relevant operational activities to Medicaid State Plan within the intrastate. SMA uses business intelligence tools to monitor progress toward benchmarks. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for intrastate exchange of information. SMA collaborates with other intrastate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable business services.
levels.level_4: extent possible across the interstate. SMA develops and maintains Medicaid State Plan with collaboration from other interstate agencies. SMA distributes in near- real time modifications to policy to stakeholders. SMA directly ties all relevant operational activities to Medicaid State Plan across the interstate. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for clinical and interstate information exchange. SMA collaborates with other interstate agencies and entities to adopt national standards, and to develop and share reusable processes including clinical information.
levels.level_5: extent possible across the nation. SMA develops and maintains Medicaid State Plan with collaboration from other intrastate agencies. SMA distributes in near- real time modifications to policy to stakeholders. SMA directly ties all relevant operational activities to Medicaid State Plan across the nation. SMA adopts MITA Framework, industry standards, and other nationally recognized standards for national exchange of information. SMA collaborates with agencies and entities for national (and international) interoperability improvements that maximize automation of routine operations.
